titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: William West Conrad (1904-1981) resided at the Union League from 1966 to his death. He was a graduate of William Penn Charter School (1919) and Princeton University (1924). He traveled extensively and was a member of many clubs, including the Wilderness Club and the Adventurers Club.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of correspondence, clippings, memorabilia, and photographs relating to Conrad's activities as explorer, supporter of young members of his extended family and of various music organizations. There are also a number of family photographs and papers. Materials related to Conrad's travels include: travel postcards and maps from all over the world; photographs and slides of Conrad and various sights; and travel brochures and itineraries. Personal and family papers include: school papers and lecture notes from Princeton University; personal correspondence and greeting cards; appointment books and diaries; framed diplomas and certificates; dinner invitations and related programs; bank books and used checkbooks; papers concerning various properties in Florida;family photographs (some framed) and photo albums; and several travel diaries kept by his mother. The collection also includes correspondence and printed materials related to Conrad's involvement with various Philadelphia area and New York City musical organizations, including the Academy of Vocal Arts and the Metropolitan Opera. There are also framed paintings, scrapbooks and loose newspaper clippings, as well as newspapers related to significant events; newsletters and magazines related to Conrad's interests; and various books, mostly related to travel, such as phrase books and dictionaries. The collection contains some personal items and German coins and Italian currency (circa 1947).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Academy of Natural Sciences: William West Conrad journals.
